result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Clinton J Kramer in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Charges are dismissed and read into 15CF917.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Clinton J Kramer in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The State advises the Court that the victim in the case requests the bond be modified to allow no violent contact.  The victim address the Court and requests the bond to be modified to allow no violent contact.The Court modifies the condition of the bond to that of no violent contact with Kelly K.  All other conditions remain as set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

No violent contact with Kelly K.  Parties to not discuss the case in any manner.  All communication must be in a Civil manner.  Defendant to have no contact with D.M.T., or Harold M. as listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence.
Hearing at 12-03-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Clinton J Kramer in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State needs to prepare an amended information. Defense requests a jury status/jury trial date. Court will set 15CF917 for trial and 15CF925 to trail along.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 10-14-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Clinton J Kramer in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Kay requests a modification of bail conditions.  Kelly K appears and makes statements to the Court in regards to bail.  State objects to the modification of bail conditions.    The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
